intro: Grammitis pedunculata, commonly known as the clustered spikemoss, is a member of the family Huperjiaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit. It typically forms compact clusters of slender, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or pale green moss. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Grammitis pedunculata is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surfaces of other plants without deriving nutrients from them.
